required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing Efficacy of IV Acetaminophen for Perioperative Pain Control for Oocyte Retrieval
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing Efficacy of IV Acetaminophen for Perioperative Pain Control for Oocyte Retrieval: a Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo-controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: In this research study we want to learn more about how effective certain medications are at reducing pain after oocyte (egg) retrieval surgery and how effective they are at reducing the time between the retrieval and discharge from the hospital. We will compare three types of pre-operative medications: intravenous (IV) acetaminophen, oral (PO) acetaminophen, and placebo (no medication), which is the current typical care.

detailed_description.textblock:
OBJECTIVE: To compare the efficacy of pre-operative IV acetaminophen, PO acetaminophen, versus placebo for adjunctive pain control in the setting of oocyte retrieval in an in vitro fertilization clinic setting.
HYPOTHESIS: Our hypothesis is that patients receiving IV acetaminophen pre-operatively will have improved postoperative pain scores, lower overall opiate consumption, and shortened time to discharge from PACU than those receiving PO acetaminophen or placebo.
Participants will be consented and enrolled in the study prior to their oocyte retrieval. The patient will then be randomized to one of three treatments:
Group 1: In the pre-op suite, these patients will receive 1000mg IV acetaminophen and PO placebo, followed by standard protocol anesthesia and pain control as needed.
Group 2: In the pre-op suite, these patients will receive 1000mg PO acetaminophen and IV placebo, followed by standard protocol anesthesia and pain control as needed.
Group 3:
In the pre-op suite, these patients will receive PO and IV placebo, followed by standard protocol anesthesia and pain control as needed.
The patient and care team will be blinded to the treatment group.
A member of the study staff will review participants' medical record to collect data regarding demographics, clinical history, cycle and pregnancy outcomes, up to 12 months following study completion.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: In PACU and through post-operative day 2

secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative nausea and vomiting in PACU and through POD2 (yes/no)
Oocyte yield, fertilization rate, blastocyst rate
Implantation rate, miscarriage rate, pregnancy rate, live birth (>24 weeks gestation) rate

arm_group.description: In the pre-op suite, these patients will receive 1000mg IV acetaminophen and PO placebo, followed by standard protocol anesthesia and pain control as needed.
In the pre-op suite, these patients will receive 1000mg PO acetaminophen and IV placebo, followed by standard protocol anesthesia and pain control as needed.
In the pre-op suite, these patients will receive PO and IV placebo, followed by standard protocol anesthesia and pain control as needed.

intervention.description: IV Acetaminophen for pain control during procedure
PO Acetaminophen for pain control during procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
[ ] Patient is 18 years or over, undergoing oocyte retrieval. [ ] Patient is English-speaking.
Exclusion Criteria:
[ ] Allergy/hypersensitivity to acetaminophen or opiates. [ ] Any history of liver disease, history of alcohol depending, or renal impairment as reported in the electronic health record.
[ ] Any history chronic opiate use or chronic pain disorder reported in the electronic health record.
[ ] Weight less than 50kg as reported in the medical record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Chief, Division of Reproductive Medicine and IVF, Principal Investigator, Clinical Professor
